15.
IV. Surveys #1 and #2 reflected a decrease from 1% to 11# in the
objection to the conducting of the survey. On Survey #3 it dropped
further to 7#*
From these conclusions several generalizations might be made. It
seems safe to say that a change from carrier current to M and PH will
increase community listenership. Those members of the audience who listen
to EH will continue to do so. The increase of TV set ownership seems
to have little effect on the radio listening pattern. Although, there
may be a slight objection on the part of seme respondents to a survey
of this type, those objections will decrease with repeated contact or an
increase of favorable disposition toward the University*s radio station.
The change from a limited to a full time operation has not changed the basic
policies of a student operated station. Reports of student reception
indicate a complete coverage of all student living units, both on and off
campus. The expendature of $12,000 for AM seems to be justified*
